title: I have to be honest with everyone

replies.body:
Being an ADC main, I do.

I haven't even logged on in like 2 or 3 weeks. Once I heard rumors of bruisers bot, and Taliyah jungle, I just quietly moved on to Overwatch.

Now I'm addicted to Warframe, and having a blast.

I'm the exact same. I've played a total of one game in the past three weeks, and while I still enjoy league to a certain degree when I'm playing with friends, I'm not even able to play the game anymore for the same reason that I quit my first job, I felt like, and with the removal of Marksman being relevant, feel like my time spent has been completely invalided. Now I'm playing Dauntless and Overwatch, and enjoying myself quiet a bit. 

As much as everyone else is loving how Marksman aren't in the meta, I'm waiting for whenever they're at least made viable again.

>I'm waiting for whenever they're at least made viable again.

But that's right now. That didn't change at all in fact. The majority of bot laners are adcs and are doing fine. Some that are struggling are getting buffs next patch. Additionally IE got hotfix buffed, Stormrazor got buffed + adjusted, and Essence Reaver got adjusted to help some who are struggling use it better.

I haven't even logged on in like 2 or 3 weeks.

But now that the Sacrifice is out, and I have my new Umbra......I don't know why, but I'm having a blast.

Same. I came to play this game when ADCs got nerfed. Joined the game and i had a taliyah jungler, and a Brand adc. Lost the game, realized that everyone is doing that every game instead of playing actual junglers/adcs. Downloaded Fallout 4, went on survival mode, level 48 now and love playing it
logged  in just to say tali is  tier 1 jg atm, just   saying

While it is a breath of fresh air, alienating and borderline taking away the game from a large part of the playerbase is not acceptable.

It's always from one extreme to another with Riot. They make something completely useless or so broken it defines the meta for months. They never seem to find the middle spot.

They didn't though.

According to Lolalytics, the Top 5 pickrate champions in the adc role are Lucian, Ezreal, Kai'Sa, Jhin and MF
And Lucian, Jhin and MF are rocking some very good winrates to go with it.

The top 5 winrate champions in the ADC role are Quinn, MF, Brand, Kayle and Zilean.
But outside of MF these champions have very low pickrates, the highest being MF with 10.6%, followed by Quinn with 1.3% pickrate.
So I'd argue that's not too statistically reliable

Yes. The ONLY Adcs that remained viable. Meanwhile {{champion:22}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:498}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:429}} have been utterly gutted as a tradeoff.

And if you're going to tell me that pick rates prove otherwise then it means there was something already wrong with the balancing of these champions.

Draven: 52% wr 9% pr 
Jhin: 51% wr 12.8% pr
Vayne: 49% wr 9.7% pr
#GUTTED btw

I can go on, but those are some examples.
The point I was making with my previous comment is that Marskmen are not only still viable, some of them are actually the Top tier botlane champions.
And some marksmen, like Trist for example, are in a bad spot and are getting compensation changes.
And it's not like there weren't good and bad marksman champions before this patch.

So no, this patch did *not* ''Remove'' marksmen from the game at all.

Do you really think i am going to trust some third party site for accurate data? I have played about 50 games as Kayn this patch and i haven't lost a single game against Vayne, Jhin or Draven. They have lost every game. The fact that people play them means they're setting themselves up for defeats. And most of that data is only relevant below Platinum where practically any composition is viable.

This patch turned pretty much every crit-based Adc useless because of how quickly the game snowballs so they do not have enough items even when ahead to hit their powerspike and make a difference before on-hit Adcs like Kai'Sa and Varus outscale them.

And before you reply, go and actually read the Patch Notes.

>Do you really think i am going to trust some third party site for accurate data?

Well they're necessarily going to be more accurate hitting Riot's API for wide-scale data than your sample size of one, so...

I don't really care because as is known, 85% of the League community is beneath Platinum. I had a 67% win rate (on Kayn) before i hit Platinum IV. I am now at 64% and am having far greater difficulty in playing because suddenly people actually know what matchups mean. What builds mean. What strategies mean. Where their champions' limits are. Where my champion's limits are. But ofcourse, use my alleged naivety to steer the argument off topic until it becomes a kitchen fight of insults and berating. I have totally never experienced that before..

You're the one that made the smarmy quip:

>Do you really think i am going to trust some third party site for accurate data?

Nothing alleged about this statement. It's wrong, it's belies a shocking ignorance of basic statistics, and you should know better than that. I'll not remain silent on obviously bogus statements out of some desire to "remain on topic". Acknowledge your mistake and move on.

That is smarmy? I had to open the dictionary and ironically, that is not smarmy. Third party sites are widely known to be inaccurate for upwards of 3% +/- inaccuracies. Or however else you say that in English.

And i explained why i don't believe that crap because it is most likely outdated data across all of League's population, many of which are not unique acounts and are shared between individuals.

But even if that wasn't the case, this is in no way an estimate above Platinum because i have not seen a single crit-based Adc in my games on this patch (at least not on the winning side) for the most obvious of reasons. Meddler himself said that crit-Adcs have been practically excluded from the role and they're looking into fixing this. You're going to argue with me or the Lead Gameplay Designer now? I don't care about your moral high ground based on downvote count.
I too like to deny the value of statistics because they don't comfort my view of reality.

I too like to ignore the entire reply instead of addressing the points the person makes.

Except that i don't. That is not how you argue.

You claim that the stats I provided, which are factual, are irrelevant, because your own 50 game samplesize doesn't match them, then go on making hyperbole claims in the latter part, followed by telling me to 'read the patch notes'.

And you're actually expecting a proper reponse to that?
Mate if you're gonna go ahead and tell me the sky is pink, I'm not gonna write an essay on why the sky is in fact blue and not pink.

So instead you expect me to believe your argument because some random ass third party site has win rates and pick rates that are god knows how dated and from what rank, despite the Lead Gameplay Designer himself admitting that crit-based Adcs have been excluded from the role and that they're looking into fixing this ASAP.

And trying to ridicule me doesn't exactly hold up as an argument. 50 games is enough to make an educated guess that these champions do not work anymore. If they were in the meta, i'd see at least a few on the enemy team. Well...i did but as i said, they all got crushed completely. Not a single time did any of them stand a chance against something like Lucian or Kai'Sa or another mage.

The reason behind this is because all of those champions are able to be successful using the new items, and don't rely on crit to be strong champions. Kai'sa doesn't even go AD anymore, Ezreal has one of the weirdest builds for an ADC thanks to his Q, jhin was broken prior to this update so this put him in line, MF lethality build is stronger, and Lucia has some weird build path with black cleaver and essence reaver to abuse those items. 

I think another issue is that crit ADC players still think they are strong earlier then they really are.

Jhin builds Stormrazor RFC IE.
Draven builds Stormrazor RFC IE, Sometimes rushing BT, and then building those items.
Lucian is building some Crit items and some non crit items (ER, Bork, BC are common, but so are RFC, PD etc), but yes. He prioritizes different stuff.
Kai'Sa's indeed mostly running on hit builds with the occasional Runaans, but Crit is not her primary reason for buying it.

And while stormrazor is a new item, it's still a Crit item.

I'll be the last to say Crit Marskmen didn't take a hit, but the whole ''Crit marksmen are no longer played/Viable'' narrative we've got going on's just bullshit.

It's weird how people think ADC's do worse against bruisers when all their changes were oriented towards anti-tank play

I'm almost glad every time I match against a bruiser ADC, because at least it's not Draven again

I was only good with one adc anyway, and even then I preferred being support because I liked being able to protect the team.
Then I played HotS for a little bit, went back into a tank role with some damage orientation, so being able to play more durable guys in the bot lane (so I can play with my friend who plays more support nowadays) is perfect for me since I'm used to it.
Now you hqve less people to burst down because bruisers are played bot
\>When ADCs are still perfectly viable, played in pro plays and dominating the botlane despite some diversity making its way there.

I don't miss anything.

But when I play a top laner in the adc role i go mostly 24/2 on a very good match. or 7/6 for average with cs round  120 to 300.

Never really liked playing adc champions despite me being a support main. I never had history of blaming others but I'm not very good at coordinating, adc's are too squishy and too easy to shut down by other champions in the game that I just find adc a kind of a joke role honestly.

Last season was easy as fuck in support since alot of people on enemy team or my team just played mostly Twitch who is the most easiest champion to beat in team fights and in most bot lane match ups an easy forcing him out of combat so he doesn't harm my adc and other team mates.

Also supports are very super useful in taking objectives with any ally, makes dives a super breeze for the team mates.

But with adc... you can't do that unless the enemy is that super bad or you have your allies backing you up which sometimes they wont be for whatever reason.

Also in SoloQ there is alot of bad coordination especially in the EUW where there are tons of language barriers that not everyone is going to know what you're talking about.

damage alone imo doesn't win games alone anymore it's team work and taking objectives. no longer can adcs solo carry a game anymore.
I don't miss being right clicked down in 3 hits either
